sentence.annotation_second_level: also when 3m.A=IRR-be.angry-CAUS-PRF=1PL.O be.necessary 1PL.A=IRR-call-PRF-APPL.REAS-IRR=REL 3m.poss=father WH=COND 3m.S=make-once-IRR=REL so.that=EMPH all 1PL.A=fix-REGR-IRR=3n.m.O well 3m.A=make-PRF-IRR=3m.O=ADV child
sentence.translation: ‘Also when they make us [teachers] angry, we haveto call their father, so that all, whatever he [the child] did, could be resolved.’

sentence.normal: Arika imposavakakya o intsitonkakero aparoni kooya, onkamantahero iniro.
sentence.annotation_first_level: arika i=N-pos-av-ak-ak-ia o i=N-tsitoNk-ak-e=ro aparoni kooya i=N-kamaNt-ah-e=ro i=niro
sentence.translation: ‘When they fight each other or hit a woman, he [the child] will notify his mother about it.’

sentence.normal: Arika ompokahe iniro, naakataki vitsikaironi nyaantsi.
sentence.annotation_first_level: arika o=N-pok-ah-e i=niro naakataki vitsik-a-e=ro=ni nyaa-ntsi.
sentence.translation: ‘When his mother comes, I will be the one who will resolve it [the issue].’

sentence.normal: Irotaki aisatzita arika noyomitairi nonyaanate aparonira, ironyaaka noyomitairi inyaanira, ikantziri virakocha, irotaki naparoninkari.
sentence.annotation_first_level: irotaki aisatzi=ta arika no=yomit-a-e=ri no=nyaana-t-e aparoni=ra ironyaa=ka no=yomit-a-e=ri i=nyaa-ni=ra i=kaNt-tz-i virakocha irotaki n=aparoni-Nka-ri
sentence.annotation_second_level: FOC also=OPT when 1SG.A=teach-REGR-IRR=3m.O 1SG.S=instruct-EP-IRR one=DEM now=EMPH 1SG.A=teach-REGR-IRR=3m.O 3m.poss=word-poss=DEM 3m.S=say-EP-REAL outsider FOC 1SG.poss=one-NMZ-NMZ
sentence.translation: ‘Also when I teach them, I will speak their language, I will teach in his language, they say, the language of ‘virakocha’ (of outsiders), in only one language.’

sentence.normal: Ovakeraini ovakira noyomitakiri eentsipaye anta, noyomitairi inyaaniki, nonyaaniki naari.
sentence.annotation_first_level: ovakeraini ovakera no=yomit-ak-i=ri eentsi-paye aNta no=yomit-a-i=ri i=nyaa-ni-ki no=nyaa-ni-ki naari
sentence.translation: ‘When recently I taught children over there, I taught them in their language, [which is] my language too.’
‘First I will teach in my language, which the childknows.’
‘Then I will teach them, I will translate it intothe Spaniards’ language.’

sentence.normal: Ari nokantzirori pairani, ovakira nintakaro noyomitairi eentsipaye saikatsiri Pirimorishiki (Koviryaki).

sentence.translation: ‘This is what I did long ago when I began teaching children who lived in Puerto Bermudez.’

sentence.normal: Nintakari saikatsiri aka ikantaitzi Ooheroniki, ironyaaka ikantaitahiro San_Miguel_Centro_Marankiari.

sentence.translation: 'I began [to work] with the children who lived here[in the village] called Ooheroni (Fatigue), now it is called San Miguel Centro Marankiari.'

sentence.normal: Kinkivarivitakana, shiyachana irohatzi, kametsa notsikiyiro nyaatsamentotsi, inintziro evankarikapaye, ipinkatsatai.
sentence.translation: I am old [but] still [can] run, I kick the ball well, young people like it, they respect us [me].
